alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 08 at 9:42PM MST until March 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Storm total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with locally higher amounts up to 12 inches in favored areas including the Sessions Mountains and Upper Cottonwoods. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions can be expected across all mountain routes including the upper Cottonwoods, Parleys Summit, Sardine Canyon, Logan Summit, Laketown Summit, and others. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...After a brief break, snow will start again between 11pm and midnight before tapering off during the early morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
